critique: The document is an authorization from the President to the United States Food Administrator regarding regulations for licensees under the Food and Fuel Control Act during World War I. It grants the administrator power to regulate storage charges, commissions, profits, and practices of licensees to prevent unjust, unreasonable, discriminatory, unfair, or wasteful activities. The President can determine what constitutes a just, reasonable, and fair profit based on pre-war conditions. This indicates government intervention in the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. Therefore, these axes should be scored as neutral.
